Vegetable.name: Carrot
Vegetable.scientific_name:
Daucus carota Root Crop
Carrots are the most widely cultivated of root crops and should be ready for harvest about 60-80 days after sowing seeds, depending on the variety.

Solanum tuberosum Root Crop
Potatoes and yams are tubers, whereas taro and cocoyams are derived from corms, underground stems, and swollen hypocotyls. Cassava and sweet potatoes are storage roots and canna and arrowroots are edible rhizomes.
